titlestmt.titleproper: Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Art Reference Files
A Guide to the Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Art Reference Files FA522
titlestmt.author: Mary Ann Quinn

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 18:10:12 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Laurance S. Rockefeller papers, Art Reference Files

physdesc.extent: 22 card-file boxes, 13 letter-size document boxes, 1 legal-size document box

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Art Reference Files are arranged into two series: Series 1 - Art Reference Card Files, and Series 2 - Art Files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laurance S. Rockefeller's Art Reference Files contain documentation of his and his wife Mary French Rockefeller's personal collection of fine art, sculpture, porcelain, silver, decorative arts, furniture, and jewelry, and include materials on Native American, African, and Asian art.

The collection consists primarily of a card-file catalogue of the collection, which was created and maintained by the Rockefeller Family office, and of various art files maintained by his curators, Carol Kinzel Uht, Kendall P. Lutkins, and Leith Talamo.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Carol Kinzel Uht, Nelson A. Rockefeller's curator from 1949 to 1978, helped with the early cataloguing and documentation of LSR's art collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kendall P. Lutkins began working under Nelson A. Rockefeller and became NAR's joint curator with Cynthia Altman after Carol Uht's death in 1978. Lutkins' area of expertise was in the decorative arts, silver, porcelain, and pottery. In the spring of 1979, Lutkins coordinated the full reappraisal of LSR's art collection and his other tangible property. Over the years she assisted LSR with the management of his porcelain, silver, and other collections, advising him on his porcelain purchases or sales, and assisting with the identification or description of other items.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Leith Rutherfurd Talamo began working for LSR in 1998. A trained conservator, and the daughter of family friends, she also headed up Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center's Art Committee. Her work for LSR included reviewing, identifying, and organizing his collection of paintings and artwork; arranging for framing or restoration work; recommending pieces for de-accessioning and arranging for their donation; managing appraisals; and photographing the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted.

Materials in the Laurance S. Rockefeller papers relating to communications with his immediate family, his personal finances, and other intra-family matters, are restricted until 2029, twenty years from the date of gift.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: LSR's Art Reference Card Files were first created in the 1940s, to be a central file and record of the fine art belonging to Laurance S. and Mary French Rockefeller. The files were kept and maintained at the Rockefellers' New York apartment, at 834 Fifth Avenue, though the family office in Rockefeller Center may have started the file.

Cards were created for each art object, recording how, when, and from whom it was acquired (by purchase, bequest, or gift), and often including a full description, insurance valuation, price, subsequent appraisal values, location, and in some cases photos. Cards were updated as information changed, and Polaroid photos were later taken of many of the items as documentation of the collection. Many of the cards also carried a catalogue number, which connected the card description to inventories of LSR's and MFR's collection.

The cards were grouped according to the item location, and then filed by category. Inventoried locations include: the apartment at 834 Fifth Avenue (New York), Kent House and the Kent House Shrine (Tarrytown, NY), Echo Acre (Woodstock, VT), and LSR's New York Office (Room 5600). There are also card sections for other locations, including the Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller Mansion in Woodstock, VT, the Valley Ranch House and JY Ranch in Jackson Hole, Wyoming, and LSR's Fishers Island (NY) residence.

Categories of art items include: Fine Art, Sculpture, Porcelain and Pottery, Furniture and Decoration, Rugs, Textiles, Silver, and Jewelry. When appropriate, categories such as Fine Art, Sculpture, and Porcelain, were further broken down into Western Fine Art, Chinese Porcelain, Indian Sculpture, etc. Other categories included African Art, Native American Artwork, and Antiquities.

These rules of arrangement seemingly worked well until LSR began to disperse his artwork, through sale, gifts, and ultimately through his estate distributions. An "Out" category designated deaccessioned items, though the label also applied more generally to any object that left the apartment or other site.

The "Out" files comprise nearly a quarter of the Art Card Files. The "Out" cards form a second, parallel file to the main card files, but in general it is hard to know how reliable the distinction is. Some cards clearly indicate the disposition of an item, and in other cases its disposition may be inferred. Several cards are simply marked with an "X" to indicate that items are no longer owned. Lacking information on the disposition, it is difficult to know whether items were removed, or the cards misfiled. In other cases, information on a piece may still be found in the main files. Finally, the "Out" files do not include family selections of artwork from LSR's estate. The cards for these objects are found at the end of the Card Files series.

A series of photographs of the paintings, furniture, and decorative objects at 834 Fifth Avenue is the final component of the Art Card Files. These 4" x 6" color snapshots appear to have been taken in the mid- to late-1990s. They may be photos Leith R. Talamo took to document the collection. Photos are nominally arranged by room, but the arrangement within and among these files is not reliable.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Polaroid photos of Kent House rooms; numbered Polaroid photos of furniture items with appraisal value in various Kent House Guest House rooms (KHG 1- 29).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Polaroid photos of furniture, paintings, sculpture, and exterior views. File includes art index cards for a few pieces (giving description and provenance information). Photos numbered 1-33, with some gaps and duplicates. Set of photocopied images (7 pages) folded at back of file.
The Shrine, or Japanese Shrine, was built on the Kykuit grounds between 1908-1910.

did.unittitle: Kent House - Porcelain and Pottery (Western, Chinese, Modern)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Figurines, dinner services and other sets, tableware,vases, decorative pieces, and lamps. Polaroid photos and art index cards with description and provenance information. Photos include pencilled notations concerning location (room) and valuation. Photos are numbered KH 207 - KH 290, with some gaps and some photos out of sequence; includes some unnumbered photos (especially for several lamps).

The file is divided into the following sections: Western Porcelain and Pottery, Chinese Porcelain and Pottery, Modern Pieces, and a small section of Chinese porcelain and pottery arranged by Chait Appraisal number (Chait 1-11, 13).

As the two card files complemented each other, and as there was no apparent distinction between the two series, they have been integrated here into one numerical series (in boxes 15-17, items 1-299).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photo file of paintings, furniture, and decorative objects, grouped roughly by room. The arrangement within and among file divisions is not reliable (many of the file dividers were missing labels), and images may be filed under more than one category or room. The photos appear to have been taken mostly around 1999, for documentation and as an inventory of furniture and artwork. (Some photos are date stamped 1994 or 1995, and there are also a few prints dated 2001.) Paintings and artwork have generally been photographed singly as individual items and not in context. In most cases duplicate prints have been removed. Box 18 is divided into the following headings: General photo files (individual art items), Gallery, Guest Room, Lucy's Room, Mrs. Rockefeller's Room, Ruth's Office and Hall, 14th Floor Hall, Mr. Rockefeller's Room, Master Bedroom, Mr. Rockefeller's Office, 15th Floor Landing and Hall, 15th Floor Dining Room, 15th Floor Powder Room, Stairs (15th-16th Floors).

odd.head: General
odd.p: A unidentified numbering scheme was applied to some photos, which are marked on the back with an "S" and a 3-digit number. These photos appear throughout the file, and in a possibly duplicate, but incomplete, general series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photo file of paintings, furniture, and decorative objects, grouped roughly by room. The arrangement within and among file divisions is not reliable (many of the file dividers were missing labels), and images may be filed under more than one category or room. The photos appear to have been taken mostly around 1999, for documentation and as an inventory of furniture and artwork. (Some photos are date stamped 1994 or 1995, and there are also a few prints dated 2001.) Paintings and artwork have generally been photographed singly as individual items and not in context. In most cases duplicate prints have been removed. Box 19 is divided into the following headings: 15th Floor Living Room, 16th Floor Landing, 16th Floor Office, and 5th Floor (?).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Approximately 22 images (duplicates have generally been removed). These photos were filed separately from the other 834 Fifth Avenue images; it is not clear if there is any particular significance to this separate grouping.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Most of the prints are date-stamped January 1994, but the contact sheets and negatives are dated September 1999.

Lloyd Hyde's January 1957 appraisal of Antique Furniture in LSR's Fishers Island house was originally filed together with these cards.

did.unittitle: LSR Estate Distributions - Laura Chasin Selections and Sale

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items received by Laura Chasin. Laura Chasin purchased $600,000 worth of items from LSR's estate and then donated them to the Public Conversations Project, a nonprofit organization she had founded in 1990. The organization then converted the items to cash, by offering them for sale to Rockefeller family members in June 2005.

File consists of catalogue cards, polaroid prints, and some negatives. The prints or cards are frequently marked with the recipient's name or initials, or with a sticky note, but other items included in the file carry no indication of new ownership. It is difficult to know how complete these files are, or how reliably and accurately items have been sorted into and within them.

The prints or cards are usually marked with David Rockefeller's initials (DR) or with a sticky note, but for several other items in the file there is no indication of ownership. It is not known how complete these files are or how reliably items have been sorted into them.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 2, Art Files, is arranged in two subseries: 1) Art Collection Files - General, and 2) Art Curators' Files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This set of general Art Collection Files consists of document files that were housed together with LSR's Art Reference Card Files. Files include inventories, appraisals, insurance valuations, catalogues and purchase records, photographs and documentation of restoration work, loan requests, and some correspondence. The records provide valuable documentation on certain aspects or portions of LSR's and MFR's art collection, but the documentation is not comprehensive, as files often are partial, are incomplete, or were inconsistently maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning loans, purchases, or publication of various artworks in LSR's collection. Includes materials relating to Tseng Yuho, Milford Zornes, loan of Remington bronze (Coming through the Rye), Henry Morton, Billingsley Mansfield vases, Winslow Homer, Despiau, Erling Roberts, Monet, Dunoyer de Segonzac, John Singer Sargent (Fountain at Pocantico Hills), Ibram Lassaw, Ludovit Fulla mosaic, Larry Rivers, a Nepalese Buddha, June Harrah Lord, Resika, Ming Dynasty Buddha, bronzes for the JY Ranch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Foujita, Mon Portrait No. 3, and Winslow Homer, Shark Fishing. The original paintings were given to Princeton University and Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, respectively. Proceeds from the sale of the Winslow Homer in 1996 were used in support of the MSKCC Wellness Center. Princeton sold the Foujita at Sotheby's Impressionist and Modern Art Sale on November 11, 1999. LSR and MFR had facsimile copies made of the two paintings in 1995 (by E. V. Thaw and Co.) and hung them in their living room at 834 Fifth Ave. File concerns both the gifts and the making of facsimile copies. Includes correspondence, photos, and LSR art cards.

did.unittitle: Separated Materials and Redacted Originals from Art Reference Card Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: File contains restricted materials separated from the Art Reference Card Files and the originals of redacted cards and items. Separation sheets are filed in place in the card file, with cross-reference information to this file.

When items are redacted, the redacted copies replace the originals in the card file. The originals of redacted items are removed and interfiled in this folder along with the other separated material, but no separation sheet is used. The original file location is noted for each of these redacted originals.
In some cases, redacted items have not been marked up, as photocopying the image without its border effectively obscures the restricted information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Art Curators' Files consist of art records gathered and maintained by LSR's and MFR's curators, Kendall P. Lutkins and Leith R. Talamo. The files date mainly from the 1970s to the early 2000s, though the series also includes several records from the 1950s or earlier. While these records were filed separately from the Art Collection Files in Series 2.1, they overlap in the nature of the documents and their subjects and contents. The subseries includes inventories, appraisals, and insurance valuations; purchase and sale records; records of gifts and donations; auction catalogues; files on individual artists; and records on LSR's porcelain, silver, Native American, and Asian art collecting.

did.unittitle: Art Purchases, Gifts, and Sales - General

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes actions by LSR and MFR. File includes list of art donations, 1995-1996; Laura Chasin, LSR Family Art Sale catalogue, 2005 (for benefit of Public Conversations Project); P.C. Loo and Sons, Certificates of Antiquity for two 18th-century gilt bronze Buddhas (items CX-13, HSX-43), 1985; Moran paintings and other art at Woodstock Mansion and Billings Farm, 1988-1994; LSR fine art purchases, 1986; Memo and bid for Rodin, The Thinker, 1976; Antique Porcelain Company, purchase of Remington, Coming Through the Rye bronze, and various porcelain pieces, 1976; purchase of Demuth, Red Gladioli, from Winthrop Rockefeller estate, 1975; Fine Arts reports for 1975 and 1977; Thomas Devine memo to his successor Virginia Brown, 1968, on LSR's and MFR's art card catalogue; George Rickey, Vine mobile, 1959; Cezanne, Jug and Fruits on a Table, 1955, memo and photo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Artwork by various artists, including: (Folder 107) Larry Rivers, Washington Crossing the Delaware; Vincente Vuides; Leroy Neiman, Skiing (includes photo and transparency); J.G. Tyler, River Boat America, and sale catalogue (Sotheby Parke Bernet no. 3749, American 18th, 19th and 20th Century Paintings, April 17, 1975); and (Folder 108) Patrick Farrow sculpture; F. Cowles, Moonscape; Milford Zornes; Lloyd Sexton; tin whirligig and ivory necklaces, Sotheby's, 1983; William Zorach; Anna Mary Robertson (Grandma) Moses; Thomas Hart Benton, Hayfield and sale catalogue (Sotheby Parke Bernet no. 4290, American 19th and 20th Century Paintings, October 25, 1979).

did.unittitle: Art Purchases, Loans, and Gifts - Mary French Rockefeller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Invoices for various artworks purchased by MFR, 1950s-1960s; LSR purchases from Stuart and Turner, 1957; Gautama Buddha, Doris Wiener Gallery, 1967; correspondence concerning YWCA and Japanese and Korean artists; Kiyoshi Saito prints; MFR purchases from estate of Mary Billings French, 1952; loan to Charles Prendergast exhibit and catalogue, 1968; Paul Resika paintings, 1992, 1994. File also includes letter from Edith Halpert, 1950, concerning provenance of Toulouse-Lautrec watercolor, Au Cafe; and Carol Uht condition report, 1955, on Cezanne, Jug and Fruits, painting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: General file; mainly unsuccessful bids. File incudes photo of Bierstadt, "Cathedral Rock, Yosemite."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sale of Chinese low table and two English chairs, 1995; sale of jewelry and Buddha Sakyamuni, and estimated overcharges, 1998.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sales of Famille Noire porcelain, 1990-1991; Tobacco Leaf and Meissen porcelain, 1998-1999. Arrangements for sale of Pierre Bonnard, Robe a Carreaux, 1999, and Foujita, Mon Portrait no. 3 (on behalf of Princeton); sale of prints by Toulouse-Lautrec and Mary Cassatt (Woman Bathing), at Sotheby's 19th and 20th Century Prints (sale 7367), 1999 November 4-5. Sale of Egyptian faience Baboon at Sotheby's Antiquities sale, December 11, 2002, on behalf of the LSR Fund.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 115: Purchases and sales or gifts of art, including: Domenico Veneziano, Portrait of Michele Olivieri; Hans Hoffman, Variations on a Theme in Green (includes transparency); gifts to Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (including Cezanne, Jug and Fruits on a Table, appraisal and photo, 1985-1986); View of Old Nassau Hall, Princeton, gift to Brooke Astor; Circle of Sir Joshua Reynolds, Portrait of a Woman," from Nelson A. Rockefeller estate; Cezanne, The Large Bathers, and Matisse, Odalisque a la Jupe de Tulle (lithographs); undated inventory of porcelain china services.

Folder 116 - 1994-1995: MFR purchase of Resika, Blue Fayence. Gift of Washo baskets to Woodstock Foundation; gift of Monet, "Mme Monet in Her Garden," and of Braque, "Landscape," to LSR Fund; gifts to Brooke Astor; gifts of Buddhas to Robert Thurman, Joan Halifax, Richard Baker; Egyptian Bronze Cat to Courtney Ross.

Folder 117 - 1996-2003: (1996) Winslow Homer watercolor, "Shark Fishing," to MSKCC; Toulouse-Lautrec, "Au Cafe," to LSR Fund; Paul Maze pastels to Douglas Warner and MSKCC; Currier and Ives, "Sunnyside" print to Brooke Astor; Wieghorst, "Sioux Warrior." (1997) Buddhas to Yvonne Force and Louis Marx; "Moonscape," by Fleur Cowles; Scholar's Rock; Daumier and Degas drawings to the Arkansas Arts Center; Fujita, "Mon Portrait No. 3," to Princeton University; Ozenfant, "Pipe, Livre" exhibit request. (1998) Picasso tapestries to Rockefeller Brothers Fund; donations to MSKCC; W.J. Bennett, West Point engraving (with transparency) (purchased 1988).

did.unittitle: Asian Art - Ralph M. Chait Galleries

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item descriptions of: Large Carved Black Stone Figure and Animal (item no. 1317); Unusual Gilded Porcelain Figure of Amitabha Buddha, dated 1771 AD (item no. 16186); Small Grey Stone "Meditation Rock"; Unusual Pair of small Canton enamel figures of recumbent rabbits (item no. 16333; includes color transparency). Also includes descripion of a Khmer bronze guiding ring for a palanquin offered by J.J. Klejman. Item no. 1317 was given to Brooke Astor, 1995; and the Meditation Rock was given to Courtney Ross in 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Includes list of jewelry purchased in consultation with Frederick Dockstater, 1971; David Vernon memorial card, and letter from Betty Mitchell to Mary French Rockefeller, 1973; purchase of blankets, 1978; transport of pottery, baskets, and textiles to Wyoming, 1982-1983; purchase of Wieghorst, Sioux Warrior, from Leonard Firestone, 1994; chief's blanket given to President Clinton, 1995; appraisal of LSR's Native American Art, 2000. Includes photograph of San Ildefonso blackware pot, 1990.
